title: Tech stocks falling into a bear market
text: Mark May, Citi senior analyst, and Mark Kelley of Nomura Instinet join "Squawk Alley" to talk about popular tech stocks falling into a bear market after earnings.

title: Facebook user numbers decline as GDPR regulation weighs
text: CNBC’s Elizabeth Schulze discusses how the tech giants are investing in protecting users’ personal information.

title: The tech stock sell-off: FAANG
text: Mark Mahaney, RBC Capital Markets analyst and managing director, and Paul Meeks, WIREX lead portfolio manager, join CNBC's "Squawk Alley" to discuss the tech stock sell-off.

title: Germany orders Facebook to stop collecting user data
text:
Germany has ordered Facebook to stop collecting users data without their consent on Facebook and on third party apps and websites.
Germany's top anti-trust enforcer said Facebook has abused its dominance as a social media

title: Facebook's Data Policy challenged by german regulator
text: German Federal Cartel Office President Andreas Mundt discusses the cartel's probe of Facebook Inc. and imposition of a 12 month deadline for the company to change its user data policy. He speaks on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: Facebook ordered to change Data Policy by german regulator
text: Facebook Inc. faces a 12 month deadline to change its user data policy following a probe by Germany's Federal Cartel Office. Bloomberg's Tony Aarons reports on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: Is Facebook Really That Bad? Roger McNamee's "Zucked"
text: He was an early investor in Facebook and advised Mark Zuckerberg when the company was in its infancy. Now Roger McNamee is sounding the alarm over the company in his new book "Zucked."

title: Tech stocks rebound
text: Kari Firestone of Aureus Asset Management joins the "Fast Money Halftime Report" team to discuss tech stocks rebounding and if it's time to buy in.

title: Markets can keep working even while FANG stocks stumble
text: Morris Mark, CEO and managing partner at Mark Asset Management, and Lori Calvasina, head of U.S. equity strategy at RBC Capital Markets, join "Squawk on the Street" to discuss Alphabet earnings and the broader markets.

title: Zuckerberg downplays criticism of Facebook
text: Facebook celebrated 15 years and CEO Mark Zuckerberg thinks people should be less focused on the negative criticism of the social media giant.

title: Facebook "remains a threat to democracy" says Roger McNamee
text: Roger McNamee, Elevation Partners co-founder and early Facebook advisor, joins CNBC's "Squawk Alley" to discuss his new book, "Zucked".

title: Former Zuckerberg Mentor McNamee Criticizes Facebook's Business Model
text: Roger McNamee, co-founder of Elevation Partners and author of "Zucked," discusses Facebook Inc.'s record profit and his criticism of the social-media company's management with Bloomberg's Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Larry Haverty on whether it's time to buy Facebook
text: Larry Haverty of LJH Investment Advisors and Roger McNamee, Elevation Partners co-founder and early Facebook advisor, discuss pricing of stocks from FAANG and tech.

title: Duopoly between Google & Facebook with advertising is coming to an end
text: David Garrity of Laidlaw UK and company, Tom Simonite from Wired, and Ali Moghrabi of Morningstar break down Alphabet earnings and what it means for the company.

title: Randi Zuckerberg on growing up with Mark
text: Randi Zuckerberg discusses what it was like to grow up in the Zuckerberg household. She also shares what made her want to leave Facebook and create a media company aimed at recruiting girls into tech.

title: Facebook turns 15, here's a look at what to expect in the next five years
text: Facebook, the company that started in Mark Zuckerberg's Harvard dorm room,  now has more than two billion users amid privacy concerns.

title: Apple & Facebook's privacy debate
text: Kara Swisher, Recode editor-at-large, joins CNBC's "Squawk Alley" to discuss her op-ed in the New York Times tackling Apple and Facebook's privacy debate.

title: Here's where the Tech stocks are headed: Facebook
text: Ann Winblad, founding partner of Hummer Winblad Venture Partners, joins "Squawk Box" to discuss the where she sees the Tech stocks and the tech sector as a whole is going.

title: Facebook turns 15 years old
text: The "Squawk Box" crew revisits Facebook's launch, which occurred exactly 15 years ago, as well as where the social media giant might be headed next.

title: Investing Insights: Facebook, Inc.
text: This week on the podcast, our stock news roundup with PG&E, Apple, Facebook, and Caterpillar; an upgrade for T. Rowe Price New Horizons; Greg Warren on wide-moat asset managers; dividends among tobacco firms and more.

title: Apple's Punishment of Google an "Important Moment", Steyer Says
text: Apple Inc. temporarily pulled important app-development tools from Google after the iPhone maker decided the internet giant broke its rules. Common Sense Media Chief Executive Officer Jim Steyer discusses on Bloomberg Technology.

title: Facebook Has Strong Quarter
text: Despite ongoing data security and privacy issues, the wide-moat social networker looks well positioned for the long run.

title: Facebook was misusing Apple platform to get data from kids
text: CNBC's "Closing Bell" team breaks down the latest controversy hitting Facebook with Marc Rotenberg, executive director at Electronic Privacy Information Center.

title: Facebook growing despite privacy concerns
text: Yahoo Finance Editor-in-Chief Andy Serwer sits down with philanthropist Jean Case to discuss technology and privacy concerns in today's world.

title: Sandberg Says Facebook Is Determined to Earn Back Trust
text: Sheryl Sandberg, Facebook Inc. chief operating officer, comments on the privacy concerns surrounding the company during an interview with Emily Chang on Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia.

title: Aegis Capital analyst: "There's no Facebook alternative"
text: Victor Anthony, internet analyst at Aegis Capital, and Mike Santoli discuss Facebook and its struggles with controversies.

title: Jim Cramer on Facebook: Cloud Kings Bite Into FAANG
text: Now that we've seen the majority of FAANG's earnings, Jim Cramer weighs in on how the FAANG companies are doing in comparison to his Cloud Kings.

title: Facebook having best day since January 2016
text: Doug Anmuth of J.P. Morgan Chase joins CNBC's "Squawk Alley" to discuss Facebook's earnings report and its recent scandals.

title: Jim Cramer: Facebook's business model has leverage
text: Jim Cramer gives his take on the Facebook earnings result and conference call.

title: Facebook crushes earnings
text: Anthony DiClemente, senior media and internet analyst at Evercore ISI, joins "Squawk Box" with his analysis of Facebook's earnings report.

title: Facebook shares soar after tech giant posts record profit
text: CNBC’s Elizabeth Schulze discusses Facebook’s quarterly risks and how the company is handling risks and scandal.

title: Facebook has Armageddon-like expectations
text: Dan Ives of Wedbush Securities discusses the key takeaways from Facebook's earnings report.

title: Facebook a toxic investment?
text: Disruptive Technology Research founder Lou Basenese on Facebook's fourth-quarter results, the outlook for Federal Reserve policy and the state of the markets and the U.S. economy.

title: Facebook crushes earnings, posts record profit
text: Ross Gerber of Gerber Kawasaki Wealth Investment Management discusses Tesla and some of the challenges the company is facing.

title: Facebook's earnings report
text: CNBC's "Power Lunch" team explores what Amazon's earnings report may hold and the impact that Facebook's earnings report had with Rob Sanderson of MKM Partners.

title: Facebook is a very interesting company despite controversy
text: ARK Invest analyst Tasha Keeney on the outlook for Tesla, Amazon and Facebook.

title: Varney: Big brother has now arrived, big brother is already watching you now
text: FBN's Stuart Varney on consumers increasingly losing their privacy to big tech.

title: Facebook is reportedly paying users to install an app that collects their data
text: Facebook has been paying people in secret to install an app that allows the tech giant to collect data on how they use their smartphones, a practice that would violate Apple's terms of service for apps

title: Will be life for Apple after iPhone: Tech analyst
text: Disruptive Tech Research's Lou Basenese on Apple's first-quarter results and the outlook for Facebook.

title: Facebook shares rise after beating Q4 expectations
text: FBN’s Connell McShane on Facebook’s fourth-quarter earnings.

title: Facebook's terrible year of PR hasn't stopped its growth, says chief investment officer
text: Ed Lee of the New York Times and Kevin Landis from Firsthand Capital Management discuss Facebook and Microsoft earnings.

title: Facebook beats expectations on top and bottom line
text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports on a strong quarterly earnings report for Facebook.

title: Time to Cut Back on Social?
text: Covington, Pope Francis, Facebook's teen "spying" scandal and more: is it all coming to a head for social media and should we start scaling back? Tech pioneers, insiders and journalists debate.

title: Final trades on the The "Halftime Report"
text: The "Halftime Report" traders give their top stocks to watch for the second half.

title: Report: Facebook pays teens to install app that collects data
text: 'The Next Revolution' host Steve Hilton on Facebook and the future of Brexit.

title: Santoli: We've broken the theme that FANG has to be a market leader
text: Michael Nathanson, MoffettNathanson senior analyst, and CNBC's Mike Santoli take a look at tech stocks amid earnings week for big players like Apple.

title: Facebook under fire for reports it will combine all its messaging services
text: The CyberGuy Kurt Knutsson on reports Facebook is planning to merge the technical infrastructure behind Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp and Instagram and offers tips for how consumers can protect their privacy.

title: Focus on old tech stocks rather than new, two strategists agree
text: Savita Subramanian, market strategist at Bank of America Merill Lynch, and Jeff Saut, chief investment strategist at Raymond James, joins "Squawk Box" with their take on the markets.

title: Why Facebook is integrating WhatsApp, Instagram and Messenger
text: New York Times media reporter Ed Lee joins "Squawk Box" to explain Facebook's decision to combine its three different messaging platforms.

title: Kara Swisher on Zuckerberg op-ed: If you're going to write something, write something substantive
text: Kara Swisher, Recode co-founder and editor-at-large, joins CNBC's "Squawk Alley" to talk about her op-ed in The New York Times critiquing Mark Zuckerberg's own op-ed.
